Reviews.Title: “Great value rooms; well designed”
Reviews.Author: larissa1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Media One a few times. The rooms are small but well designed & the staff are friendly and helpful. Not the best location as there is no beach but it's not far from the public beach's at Jumeriah

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eit2103
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1.5 nights. My room was very clean, well decorated and new. Staff is very helpful, breakfast buffet is rich and its very close to Dubai Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but they cheated me”
Reviews.Author: F M
Reviews.Content: I paid for a package deal which was supposed to have included a steak buffet for two, breakfast for two, and next day brunch for 2. I was told at reception because my friend only had Australian identification he would not be counted as a second guest therefore all the perks would only be for one person with no compensation or refund. I said that a local friend could join me for these with local ID, then she claimed that the breakfast and brunch was actually only for 1 person despite my email clearly indicating for 2 people! They pretty much scammed me and cheated there. I had only checked my email after I returned home for this. I pretty much took her word since I didn't imagine they would lie to my face. Checkin was a horrible experience, their reception desk is right infront of a bar blasting out music so loud neither me nor the receptionist could hear each other. She then had the nerve to give me attitude over not hearing me despite that this is their problem? She actually huffed when I asked her to repeat a question since I have hearing problems and the music was so loud. She huffed loudly and paused, then gave me a dirty look like I was stupid and then continued to answer me. Overall was a nightmare to deal with, very rude. Also, the room service food was horrible was well. I've stayed in two star motorway hotels in the UK that offered better quality room service food. The rooms are great considering how much you pay. Good sized and great quality. Great value for money in that aspect. They are as good as some five stars I've been in. Only thing that might deter people is the music coming from the outdoor bar, but I expected that so it was not much of an issue. Overall rooms are great, but the experience and being scammed at checkin will ensure I never go back. I suggest you double check your package before booking anything to ensure what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, like sleeping in a disco ball”
Reviews.Author: kgeresy
Reviews.Content: well the design is what gets ur attention first, its really nice, makes you feel like being in a disco club, its a nice hotel, very hip , just beside the media city and very close to the marina where everything is happening well in short i would recommend it, if you like new designs

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: Great location near Dubai Internet city. The hotel is well designed and really stylish. It is close to the metro train line. The messages and themes are very 'hip' and upbeat. Facilities, amenities and space was adequate. Service was very good. But for an Italian restaurant next door, the only other nearby dining options are in the hotel. If you have business in Dubai Internet city this hotel is the best choice.,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and trendy hotel (best pancakes ever!)”
Reviews.Author: ashesc84
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Media One Hotel for 3 nights. The Hip Room is nice and clean, it even has a personalised 'welcome' message on the TV and phones which we felt was a nice touch - we felt special, haha! The bathroom as can be seen in photos is separated by the room with a clear glass which might not be suitable for some - definitely a room for young couples. The concierge was very helpful and let us know where and how to get to the main sights (Thanks Kennedy!). The buffet breakfast was superb. Definitely one of the best pancakes and crepes we've ever tasted (even better than the ones we had in France just the week before!). There's a huge selection of cooked breakfast + breads/fruits/yogurt/cereal etc, you get to eat at the verandah, and the service is just exceptional. Also, the selection of cooked breakfast varies over the 3 nights that we were there! It's close to Atlantis at The Palm, about 30 dirhams. It's about 40-50 dirhams to the Burj (remember to book in advance if you're only in Dubai for a short time). All in all, a lovely stay at Media One Hotel. Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Ilfede73
Reviews.Content: It’s a desing hotel, 19th floor high, in the media city, 20 min form the airport, 10 min from the emirates mall. From your room you can see the Palm. The style is minimal and clean with a little touch of humor here and there. Rooms are rated as Hip or Vip, Vip are bigger on an higher floor and of course more expensive. The hotel is good for business and leisure. Free wifi, swimming pool. There is a nice and modern bar in the lobby where they play good music and serve good cocktails. Buffet breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “A new style!”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad D
Reviews.Content: Very nice furniture, excellent rooms and the best breakfast. Despite of the red card you find beside your phone that claims COMPETITIVE PHONE RATES (!!!!), what makes you understand what the term "Fraud" means! every thing else were great. (235 USD for 30 minutes call!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Funky & Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maroc_NYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a work trip for 5 nights. I used to live in Dubai so I know of the area but never stayed there. Now That I moved out. my work book me there as I work for a media company. The rooms are a bit tiny but what they lack in size they make for in style. The bathroom wall-less and all glass gets a lot of raising eyebrows. I love to be to see through it=). The pool deck and bar is nice. but the pool beds needs to be changed they look worn out. The music is extremely extremely loud that I was on 16th floor and you can hear it. True it was a weekend but for someone who was flying and tired they better not go to sleep. because You just can not sleep. I love the art all over the floors and through the lobby. Good: ++Walking to distance to the Marina Walk with plenty of restaurants. ++Walking Distance to the Beach Improvements: --Breakfast Buffet can have some more choices --The beds by the pool needs more shine and to look more newer

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location + friendly and professional service = a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Media One for a total of 15 nights. I chose it by recomendation from an expat living in Dubai as a good place to go if you're travelling alone. I was here on business on my own and found Media One to be great not only for working, but also for playing! Media City is a great location for Sheik Zayed Road and all the hotel bars around the Marina as well as the infamous Barasti. But Media One itself has a lively bar on ladies night and Thursdays and does plenty of promotions. Regardless of the location, it's the service that makes this place a real winner. From the gentlemen at the entrance that would get me cabs to the guys at the bar, to reception, to the restaurant manager, I was always welcomed with a friendly smile, and I got to know the team at Media One on a first name basis ( probably because i spent far too much time in the hotel bar!) They made me feel like a valued customer and even like a friend. Anything I needed, they were there with recomendations, services, etc. I really can't say anything even remotely negative about this hotel and will definitely be where I stay moving forward when I am over here for business/pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Those guys know their job”
Reviews.Author: thesheikhfromdubai
Reviews.Content: Visiting the Media One at least 2 a month, every time I 'm pleasantly surprised by the friendly and skilled staff. Yesterday evening we enjoyed their Cheese & Wine dinner. Fabulous, Excellent, etc. I actually couldn't stop. Fantastic initiative and in a great setting. They'll see me again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, a good value. Wasn't crazy about the see-through bathroom and gimmicky marketing”
Reviews.Author: adricornell
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right in Media City, there's a bus (88) that stops almost in front and goes to many good locations, and the Metro is about a 10 minute walk. Taxis are dirt cheap, and you can get to Jumeirah Beach for about 15 AED (3-4 Euros or 4-5USD). They have some great food and drink deals (including 120AED for unlimited drinks and chef's choice). The bartenders were very friendly, as were the rest of the staff. The gym and pool are very nice. My only complaint had to do with the fact that you have to pay for internet (outside of the public areas, it's free there), the room had a bathroom that you could see straight through (not sure if they only give this to solo travelers, but it is a turn-off), and I am not a huge fan of gimmicky marketing, which is at the cornerstone of their strategy. Still, it was a great value, every taxi driver knows it, and you will enjoy Dubai if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice n Trendy”
Reviews.Author: adityamalhotra
Reviews.Content: Trendy and Chic, it has got a modern design with a good bar and restaurant. Friday afternoons are chilled and relaxed with the brunch buffet got a decent spread and nice music. The hotel is well located close to other hotels around media city as well to the Dubai Marina and most night spots. The rooms are well appointed and clean, though room service is a little slow. The gym is well equipped and very well maintained. Overall, its a neat hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheek, Fun, Elegant and Retro....MEDIA1”
Reviews.Author: Louis D
Reviews.Content: awesome place in Dubai...great rooms overlooking the city..close to downtown, shopping, etc...great hotel activities and really a fun exciting place!!

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalieabudhabi
Reviews.Content: When we were booking a room we were told on the phone it would be 800AED which was a little too much for just a bed for a night out in Dubai. We checked the website and noticed an offer for 969AED where: drinks from 6-8pm, buffet, breakfast the next day, brunch with alcohol and late check out were offered!! was silly not to have been told this on the phone & we jumped at the chance. Hotel location is in Dubai marina so plenty going on. We arrived at the hotel to be told no valet so had to park the car then take our bags through to the lobby, check in was ok but not as quick as it could have been. We had drinks in the lobby 6-8 and a buffet upstairs which was excellent. The rooms are compact but fine for a night stay, not sure about longer. The tv was on the right side of the bed which made it difficult to watch when lying down but not a big problem. The bathtub was lovely with a head rest. WI-FI is charged when used in room but if you go to the lobby its free!! We had a pool view and were woken up to loud music being played for the brunch but it was ok as we were going to brunch... brunch was ok, we only had food but I reckon its more aimed at people wanting to drink 12-4 like most Dubai brunches ;-) Check out was quick, all in all a great stay and fantastic offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLandJL
Reviews.Content: I chose the media one hotel for the work incentive I run every year. There was a group of 28 of us and on price and location this hotel was a great choice. Hotel is clean , modern, lovely rooms, I was in room alone as on business and bathroom is in a glass enclosure so not ideal if u prefer more privacy. The swimming pool was great, especially as it was on the roof so great views. Staff were friendly. We only had breakfast there but food was good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Hip" rooms and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here numerous times, mostly because the rates are decent ( 550 dhs before tax) and the location is great if you want to stay on that end of Dubai i.e: JBR and near Mall of Emirates. The first time i stayed here, they put in me in a smoking floor which i did not request, but other than that ive never had a problem with them. The hotel tries to be hip and funky with its different room layouts. i notice a lot of people on their laptops in the lobby so i assume it caters to many business and media related people (being located in Media city). I dont reccomend this hotel for families with small children as usually on weekends you can hear music coming from the pool bar / club. tea and coffee as well as small bottles of water are provided. The view is good if you manage to get a sea view. Basically the hotel is convenient to stay in if your there for a short trip be it business or a fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Froggie_traveller
Reviews.Content: It could potentially have been a nice place, but there were too many things that bothered me... white sofas in the entrance aren't white anymore but dirty grey, and same in my room, my chair was stained, there was a leak in my bathroom (although I admit it was fixed quickly after I asked), my door key stopped working and had to be changed 3 times during a week long stay... Pool closes at 7pm (or 7.30pm maybe), not enough time to even have a dip after work, and the very loud music of course on weekends... On the positives: nice staff and good breakfast... is that enough though?! Not for me...

Reviews.Title: “If you are a drunk lad or if you need to be in the area, go, otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: imardell
Reviews.Content: Don't know wether to mark poor or average really Well, the hotel desperately trie to have a "hip" in everything : the atmosphere, the music, the little comments... it just fails to deliver much i strongly discourage anyone going for anything under what the call VIP level (a clean, nothing-to-it-smallish room), otherwise, you shall have a purely skyscarper views with audible music from the pool are until midnight On certain nights, the lobby is just one big disco... which is fine unless you need to have a conversation at someone at reception The breakfast is cheap/average, depends on your standards : orange juice is of extremelly poor quality for instance Let's be fair, the rooms are clean and if you have a sea (the palm) view, they are ok. The main problem is service : call room service, you may end up on an answering machine. The food is... average (tiramisu is not good, ice cream neither) if you choose something they don't "makeé such as an Angus Beef, you're ok though Another example, you leave your room service tray at say 11PM, the day after at 10 AM it has not yet been picked up !!! (luckily there are no rats around) : this morning's experience So, the location is good, if you're just there to get hammered in the Marina, fine. Otherwise..

Reviews.Title: “Go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Thirtyyearjourno
Reviews.Content: If you are a grown up - do jot stay here. Pretentious oversold Premier Inn. As I write - at 1am - the thumping beat of house music outside makes it impossible to sleep and I'm on the 19th floor! Despite complaints to management they refuse to turn it down. When I asked what time it would stop they said 2.30. Great. First business appointment of the day at 7.30. Suffice to say this is an overhyped, utterly arrogant and oversold establishment that cares little for guests and far far more about image. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here but Not sure if we will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Spencemarc
Reviews.Content: Not a great start when the keys to two rooms did not work! Told to wait with no AC or electricity while they tried to fix it. Awoke this am to the sound of workmen outside the room doing what appears to be major renovation work! The rooms adjacent to these works should not be used when it is taking place! That said its a great location and very good value for money in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: The main reason I chose this hotel was it's location in Media City. It's a hip hotel, with modern room design and alot of glass. Check-in was long-ish even though it was past 11pm and I was the only one checking in, took about 5 minutes with alot of paperwork. My room on the 15th floor looked out to the pool and bar, beware of the fact that this can be very loud. I definitely wouldn't want to be on a lower floor. Room equipped with Flatscreen, two phones, desk and seperate chair. Bed was comfortable, Bathroom amenities are standard. Taking a shower in the bath tub proved to be a bit uncomfortable but ok. You can also see that there's no attention to detail by the cleaning crew, I would have expected the room to be cleaner. There was hair on my bed, definitely a no-go. Check-out took ages, I must have waited around 25 minutes almost messing up my meeting. Also tried room service. It was quick but quality of the club sandwich wasn't that appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Media One Hotel Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Abilio R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on New Years because my previous reservations had been cancelled and all other hotels were booked. It was alot more than I would have spent but it was last minute. The room is small, half of it occupied by a glass surrounded bathroom, the bed is placed between the glass bathroom wall and the window. The desk is a sliding small glass top next to the TV, there is a iPod station under it as well. Standard basic amenities in the bathroom. The overall atmosphere of the property is hip and trendy. I really did not spend much time at the hotel but if the price was reasonable I may consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “if you need the location media city.”
Reviews.Author: JeddaCath
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when landed in Dubai with no place to stay and all hotels booked during vacation and convention time. The agent at the airport booked via booking.com and ended paying the full rack rate of $1200 for one night! This is 10 times what this hotel room would be worth. Does it work or not does not matter. I wouldn't have stayed here had I not had no options. The room is small, half of it occupied by a glass surrounded bathroom, the bed is placed between the glass bathroom wall and the window. The desk is a sliding small glass top next to the TV, there is a iPod station under it as well. Standard basic amenities in the bathroom. The overall atmosphere of the property is trying to be overtly hip, like a trendy club/lounge. However the stay was comfortable and the room was quiet. The staff at check in was ok too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, limited menu”
Reviews.Author: Oiltraveller
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay with the Media One Hotel, excellent service while checking in early morning even though my booking was incorrect for checking in later the day only. With a long business stay the dinner menu is seriously limited, but when doesn't it happen when you stay in a hotel for longer than a month. Overall clean, tidy and the food is tasty. Excellent service when I required a copy of my passport from the front desk. Quick and easy access to Shaikh Zayed road and an easy walk to the Metro with the bridge across the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Fair enough. Beleive all good reviews. No noise at all.”
Reviews.Author: Kemsh
Reviews.Content: Music in reception was kinda energetic, not noisy. Blue lighting was very strange to me, yet funky. Room somewhat small (I got the Hip room) but had all I needed (I POD station). Good value of money all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy modern hotel and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Iain S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Media One for, in total, almost two months on repeat business trips in mid 2010. The hotel offered great value compared to all other hotels in the country, and provided a very high standard of service and comfort. If you can ignore the over-the-top attempts at being trendy, it is a very clean, comfortable and modern hotel. It has car parking on site and easy access to the main Sheikh Zayed Road for travel into down town Dubai or Abu Dhabi. It is located close to the beach and a short taxi ride from the Dubai Marina walk. The Dubai Jazz and Food festivals were held in the park opposite the hotel, so was great to walk over the road to take those in when they were on. The rooms are glazed from floor to ceiling, and feature glass walled en-suite bathrooms. The furniture is all customised for the rooms, but the graphic design on the walls let it down (another of the trying too hard to be trendy flaws). The rooms featured wi-fi and cabled internet access (at an additional charge), but there was wi-fi in the public areas. The pool was amazing, and virtually empty first thing in the morning. The hotel also had brand new gym facilities which overlooked the sea. The room service, restaurants and ground level bar all did fantastic food. The hotel was popular at the weekends, particularly the 'Dubai brunch' events it puts on. This was great for finishing up a hard week's work and for entertaining colleagues and friends, but was also one of the hotel's downsides as the music could be heard faintly through the multiple glazed windows facing the pool and it got a little busy in reception with 'worse for the wear' brunch guests. The door staff and security was very efficient in that respect, and almost all Dubai hotels do 'brunch' so it is hard to avoid anywhere in the city. Having stayed in half a dozen or so other hotels in Dubai and Abu Dhabi, I'd certainly return to Media One.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and hip”
Reviews.Author: Q8Smitty
Reviews.Content: I like Media One. The staff is really very nice and genuine. The rooms are so bright with floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom is all glass too. Some say rooms are a bit small, but I think they're just fine. Larger than European standards, for sure. The pool doesn't get much sunlight from what I can see..... So avoid this hotel if you want to take a sunbath. I gotta admit, the one thing I didn't like was that upside Christmas tree in the lobby. I didn't like that trend 4 years ago and I still don't like it. It's seems a bit forced. Next year stick to a conventional tree. It's my first night and all seems great with this hotel..... I recommend this joint and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: abcd53
Reviews.Content: We liked many things about this hotel. The people were great at check in, our room was super clean, stylish, and had a great view, and the location is perfect. In fact, from the view of our room, we could see people skydiving over Jumeriah Beach. The morning the breakfast buffet had a decent selection and one of the servers noticed my husband wasn't thrilled with the coffee so he went and brought us expresso. That made our day. We used the gym and it was great. There were two bummers: 1) At night there was a party going on until very late (2 or 3 am) and we had a hard time sleeping in the noise. They did bring us earplugs when we asked for them. 2) The pool area has no sunlight during the day so it was cold and therefore not a desirable place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: notlikingit
Reviews.Content: I just think its not worth the money. Its very teenage, collage student hotel not a family hotel. But very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Painful.”
Reviews.Author: kox_patrol
Reviews.Content: If you care about things that actually matter, Media One has so-so beds, so-so service, so-so food. You probably won't die, and if you have earplugs or sleeping pills to block out the round-the-clock sound of clubbing from downstairs, you might even get some sleep. If you care about the way a hotel presents itself, Media One appears to be managed by a hormonal teenage girl. The room service menu is filled with items with names like "your schmuffaluffamouch breakfast" (an omelet?), "simple and understated, yet trendy" (fruit), "it's just so, so good" (a pancake) and lengthy, overwrought definitions of words like "breakfast" and "room service". The walls in the rooms are covered in inexplicable graphics from the early 90s, artists' renditions of what the internet must look like. These things would probably be easily fixed, as the bones of the hotel aren't bad. If they can just fire the person who thinks that the way to make a hotel feel hip and fashionable is to write "hip" and "fashionable" on every surface, they'll be in fairly good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel - Great Business Centre and good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoghnasmac
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Media One Hotel. I opted for a regular Dubai taxi rather than one of the Mini All FOUR cars that would have been sent as a hotel car. Reception area and staff all very modern and classy. Lots of glass, metal and clean lines. Staff were effiecient and welcoming throughout checkin. Room was a good size and had nice floor to ceiling outlook - the view from my room was not of much but was OK. Facilities in the room were good - especially liked the iPOD docking station. Why is this not an essential element of every 5 star hotel? A few negatives....the built in furniture in the room was not really to my liking. It had all the storage you would want but looked - well a bit ordinary. I checked in sometime around Halloween and had the misforture of being only 3 floors above and just round the corner from the pool where there was a pool party to 2am or 3am.....i asked for another room but apparently the hotel was fully booked...what is the Halloween equivalent of Bah Humbug! Breakfast and meals were generally good. Business Centre was excellent. Facilities, Service, Layout, attention and support of staff etc. You want a meeting at Dubai Marina - try this place. Didn't try the pool or gym - it was a little windy when i was there and I had no time in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel Comes Up Short”
Reviews.Author: JRD36
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to rate. It is really clean, very sleek. The rooms are nicely furnished, the buffet adequate, and the pool area very nice. The 2 major things that bring this hotel down are: -Service: The service was very inept at reception, and it seemed like their mentality was to do the bare-minimum. ie: internet in your room is not free, and to get it, you have to go down to reception to pay for it. -Noise: I would highly discourage any family to stay here. There is a club on floor 8 that is outdoors and the DJ is on high volume the whole night. If you plan on taking part, you shouldn't be worried. However, if you aren't part of it, the music and pounding base will go to at least 3am.

Reviews.Title: “recommendable for European taste”
Reviews.Author: Pixxi
Reviews.Content: If you're in Dubai for business located next to Media City and you like European styled hotels, Media One Hotel is the right choice. No heavy carpets and cosy corners but cool style and functionality carachterise this accomodation. The pool on the breakfast-floor is worth using after a hard working day. The rooms are furnished modern and functional, noting missing. The restaurant's offer is average but I never had problems digesting. Fees are moderate. Service in general excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Media One-derful!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJA
Reviews.Content: Great location! Near the metro train, public beach, marina and malls. Perfect service! 5star amenities inside the room. With wi-fi and Ipod docking station. Fantastic pool with wifi access too and turns into a lounge in the evening. I'm a fan!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Safety First”
Reviews.Author: Mhaikey S
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is very good, all can be requested free of charge but, i dont think safety should be requested. It should be the priority of the hotel management. i have slipped two times at the bathroom, i need to request the anti slip mat because i was informed it should be requested. all other things are okay to request like towels, soap or shampoo but not the safety mat, it should be automatically available inside the bathroom now its the guest choice whether to use it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with good food and service”
Reviews.Author: debbie_armet
Reviews.Content: located near he marina and in the madia city it is a refreshing hotel with great food - large portions so share! free wifi outside your room nice pool area on floor 8 but skyscrapers hide the sun until after midday dont book the hip room if there are 2 of you for more than a few days as very compact - beter for solo

Reviews.Title: “Many better places to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Tanis T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai and this is one of the worst I’ve experienced. I booked based on good recommendations from friends so perhaps I caught the hotel on a bad night. After negotiating Dubai's ever changing roadways and driving past the hotel twice with no clear way of accessing it, I drove aimlessly up to the unmarked front door. The gentleman at the front did not know enough English or Arabic to tell me that I would have to self-park so I just stood in front until another fellow came out to explain where to put my vehicle. Check in was friendly and quick. The room was as expected according to the photos. The TV wasn't working and I was told it was an issue with the telecom company. I ordered room service and didn't receive an item that I had asked for, even though I mentioned it three times while ordering. When room service arrived, the guy was surprised to see that my TV wasn't working. He called maintenance and they came a while later to fix it. Apparently it was not a telecom problem. I was exhausted from a long day so I thought I would take a bath and then get a good night's sleep. Two problems prevented that. First, the hot water would not come for the bathtub (though it worked for the shower). Second problem was the pool party outside my window. From what I could see, there wasn’t a great turnout for the party so I’m not sure why the music had to be so loud! At checkout they couldn’t get the credit card machine to work so they processed the charges later and emailed me the receipt. They did get this part correct. This place does have the potential to be a great lower cost place to stay in Dubai. But I won’t try it again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Maryoma
Reviews.Content: It is super modern. Very clean and friendly service. I loved the stay there, with it's unique style in the heart of Media city. It has great location and excellent aiprort pickup with a mini cooper. The rooms are a bit tiny with glass walls surrounding the bathroom but the beds are very cozy. It is great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: k_beeBucks
Reviews.Content: a very enjoyable stay in a very good hotel. Contemporary clean and comfortable. The food is great, rooms well appointed and; in our case; very quiet. the hotel is about 15 min walk from the beach or £2 in a taxi !! Go to the Barista bar and use the 'free' beach sunbeds by buying a few drinks. The pool has little sun and only from about 1130 to 1430 and then early evening. Staff are excellent and the gym is very good for general fitness. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, funky, fresh, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry A
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with plenty or quirky marketing that makes it more memorable than your average hotel stay. The food isn't as good as it could be to be honest but there isn't a shortage of places to eat a short taxi journey away anyway. The bar, restaurant and gym are all on the 8th floor, good entertainment on the 8th floor pool bar....unless your room is directly above it, in which case you aren't sleeping until it closes at 2 am. Friendly staff and good service along with the modern, quirky design makes it a good option. I would stay there again and happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not the best choice if you plan to sleep before 3 AM”
Reviews.Author: meloddica
Reviews.Content: I had a company training at media one for couple of days, overall I enjoyed my stay, very friendly staff, tasty breakfast choices, good business facilities, clean trendy rooms and decoration. However my early morning training was planned on weekend so it was impossible to have a good night sleep because of the very loud music that kept playing till 3:00 AM. what I liked the most is the idea of transparent bathroom walls although I think it would be awkward if you are staying with a friend at same room, also I liked the "cool" lingo the hotel used in all their don't disturb and clean my room signs, even the customer survey you have to fill when checking out was pretty cool, it is nice to see hotels get creative that way! I would stay again in Media one, hopefully won't have another weekend training there though.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but surrounding area under construction”
Reviews.Author: BiBi493
Reviews.Content: We arrived there at 4.00AM, after a long trip from Venice. The staff at the desk was kind but a bit slow. We were assigned a room on the last floor, that was large, nice and clean but noisy due to the air conditioning motors right above the room on the roof. We were too tired to ask for changing at the moment, but we did the morning after and they gave us another room without any problem. The new room was confortable and large as the previous one. The wiew from the room could be spectacular, if there were something else than skyscrapers under construction around.

Reviews.Title: “my first trip in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Feifei F
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a modern design of transparent bathroom. Some ppl might get uncomfortable with it, but i strongly go with this style since it makes the whole room bigger and spacious. Breakfast is good, but hopefully the buffet menu could be changed slightly day to day. BTW ppl get really crazy on thursday night, and on my last night in Dubai which is thursday night, there was loud disco music around. Not sure where it comes from, since i lived on the 17th floor. Things other than that are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Boom Boom Boom, can't fall asleep in my room”
Reviews.Author: 16by9
Reviews.Content: Rave thumping music throughout the hotel, in the lounge, at the buffet, out by the pool. 1 am and the pool party is still on, and is well heard 8 floors up. Nice and clean, smaller but well appointed rooms. Charged us to call the Spa for an appointment, because it's in the next building. Wouldn't turn down the music at the pool, even when 4 separate people complained, and there were only 6 people there. Couldn't have a decent conversation with friends without yelling. I'm sure it's great for the under 30 crowd.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL. VERY HELPFUL, EFFICIENT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: BillHLondon
Reviews.Content: My first time to Dubai .. a short business trip. Very comfortable rooms And smoking rooms for us bad boys Big bed Good bathroom Good air conditioning that didn't freeze you to death Excellent breakfast Very helpful, efficient, friendly staff everywhere.. ESPECIALLY Rizaldy Banga on the front desk One small downside .. no snacks/crisps/chocs in the mini bar. :-(

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Timymc
Reviews.Content: Media One is a fairly decent hotel by all standards. The breakfast is good with plenty to offer. The pool and gym are pretty cool, clean and modern. As advertised it is pretty funky and out of all the hotels I've been to this year, Media One Hotel has had the friendliest staff.

Reviews.Title: “I always enjoy my stay at the Media One Hotel in Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: joelarias
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my stay at the Media One Hotel in Dubai. I have been coming to this hotel for a long time now. Every time I fly into Dubai I make the Media One my first destination. The hotel has wonderfully stylish and modern room, with chic furniture and an iPod dock, which I am always in search of, and free wifi. The cafes downstairs have great foods and drink and the rooftop pool has great bar for the night with music. The breakfast is amazing and I always see the promotion for other meals offered at the 18th floor restaurant, but have not yet been to them. Hopefully someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel suitable for business, or young couples/singles”
Reviews.Author: SAJR88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2011. The location is convenient for Media City, the Marina, and JBR. The hotel is very good value for the level of service. I received an excellent internet rate. I used room service, the restaraunt, the lobby bar, pool, and business centre. The overall service standard was good and staff were friendly and helpful. The whole hotel is designed in a modern funky style which is different from most regular chains. The swimming pool is well laid out but is in the shade for a lot of the time due to other high rise buildings. There are no shopping centres close by, but Mall of the Emirates is not too far by taxi. Overall a good hotel, best for business, or young couples, oryounger single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, centralized location, clean and good services”
Reviews.Author: Wtswah
Reviews.Content: Been staying there for business trip. It is near the Metro thus convenient to travel around. Also, there's free shuttle bus to Dubai Mall and few other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great view, great staff, fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Schweizer12345
Reviews.Content: The Media One Hotel Dubai is located in Dubai Media City next to internet city. We took took the offer at check-in to upgrade to a suite. - A great choice !!! From the living room we had a great view over the Sheikh Zayed road and the Emirates Hills crossing. From the bedroom we saw palm island with the Atlantis hotel. All the staff of the hotel was super friendly & helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much and we highly recommend the Media One Hotel Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: ALOtaiba
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserve to be 5 star Hotel. The hotei's servies is the best. The rooms are modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ture Media. True One”
Reviews.Author: Fareed85
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights on Business trip.. and really really enjoyed the stay.. everything was great.. stayed in hip room..the room itself was a surprise when i entered.. it was in a tilted fashon.. with glass walled bathroom.. which gave a very elegant and different feeling.. breakfast was awesome too.. the room was very coz.y. good channels on TV.. nice Air con.. overall a wonderful expereince.. i will recommend this to any traveller on busiess or leisure.. Great Stay..

Reviews.Title: “The best option”
Reviews.Author: rafael_torrelo
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of reasons to tell that Media One is the best option in Dubai. The balance price-quality, the friendly and efficient staff (from Director to the last employee), the funny parties, the nice food (Chef Nicolas is a true value)... Some people will tell that gym and pool, rooms, lobby and rest of places at the hotel, are not "the bigger" (as they consider that everything in Dubai should be the bigger, the taller, the larger... and also the most expensive for nothing and grandilocuent) but you feel very comfortable while using it, and that is increasing as much time you spend in the Media. You have to test it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: DanGB1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last year. Great hotel, nice and fairly new. Really friendly staff. didnt use much of the facilities as was bush with business but did stop off at the pool on the last day! Nice pool, with a decent view too. Would stay here again no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome,awesome,awesome”
Reviews.Author: Dellydelight
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Innovative,funky,kind and friendly, a breath of fresh air in the mundaneness of life.Cant wait for my next stay.Staff,rooms,reception,restaurants and bars were all fab. Adele

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great, another fantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: berlinaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again at Media One, this time by myself on business. Once again fantastic, although following my previous stay the expectations were of course sky high. For me when it comes to Hotels, consistency is what counts....and that is what they delivered. Perfectly clean; friendly, efficient Service and great location with a low price tag compared to other Hotels in Dubai. Try the Steak night on Thursdays in their Restaurant on the 8th Floor, really great quality and value and if you feel like spoiling yourself, upgrade to a Seaview Room for only 17 Euros more per night! I said it before and I say it again....WELL DONE, MEDIA ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “out of this world, the best”
Reviews.Author: kebzart
Reviews.Content: Great service throughout from start to finish, made our first stay in Dubia amazing. Pool and pool staff top marks., Room great view and clean throughout, nice little funky extras. Food and service top marks, made us feel special.

Reviews.Title: “We Love The Hotel and Soon We Will Come To The Hotel ;)”
Reviews.Author: Rawahi
Reviews.Content: The service was so excellent also the staff they so friendly, especially the breakfast was so delicious and the bed its so comfortable and there is one of the team from the hotel her name is Ms. Sou she is working at the reception we would like to thank her for the good service. Best Regards, Nasser Al Rawahi & Faisal Al Rawahi Sultanate Of Oman alrawahi_80@hotmail.com & doob27@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Cool and comfortable, feel like home.”
Reviews.Author: Jhomarjhory
Reviews.Content: It's so memorable experience . Highly recommended to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Staff for large group”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Nomads
Reviews.Content: I had a large group of suppliers stay with the Media One. Media One arranged everything from visas to airport pick-up and drop-off and did so without a glitch. They accommodated last minutes requests with a smile. The hotel is lively in the evenings, but also offers quiet, relaxing areas as well. I will definitely stay with Media One again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Some things need to be cranked up others need to be cranked down!”
Reviews.Author: TLCLJP
Reviews.Content: We stayed as part of the 'Crank it Up' promotion. It is pitched as a "momentous weekend 24hour party package for the summer". We essentially wanted to just spend a night away and chill out. The package for the promotion is not entirely clear and we had to ask several times for an email confirmation however it does not really outline specifics of the package. It is only when you arrive at 6pm that they tell you that you cannot have access to the room until after 9 pm which we found odd and inconvenient. Drinks in the Z:one bar were quite watered down and as part of the package - very limited in choice. We were told we could not have red wine although eventually the staff offered to provide a glass when we asked if we could just pay for it instead of drinking weak vodka, lime and soda. Steak dinner in the Med was okay although the wine choice was a little rough. Service was very attentive and the staff really tried to anticipate your needs - the service was far better than the standard of food. It was ok - just ok - but nothing to really get excited about. It seems odd they would have a steak promotion but not have any mashed/jacket potatoes as choice in the very small buffet area. Dishes were not replenished regularly so some empty bowls were often seen. The hip room is of a reasonably good standard - 4 stars is appropriate here. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom area was spacious. Anything you needed was pretty much available in the room. We skipped breakfast in the hotel and came back to spend time at the pool. It's a decent sized pool but strangely there are no umbrellas to offer shade if you need it. The sun beds are great to lie on but really need to be cleaned each day as there was a thick layer of sand that discoloured the pool towel after you laid down on it. Brunch in the Med, was again very average in terms of food. Salads were the same as the night before or were clearly a creation of the left-overs from the night before. The service was again very attentive but the quality of the food was really quite average and bland. We were told we could order pizza as requested however when we went to order one, the guy refused and told us to take the pieces that were already there....and had been there for some time as they were cold. We wanted to take some time to just chill out in the room and catch up on some sleep, however this was not an easy task as the music from brunch could be heard and felt two floors up. Most disturbingly, we received at least 6 telephone calls during this time to the phone in our bathroom (yes, the toilet) from the reception staff. We complained about this as they seemed to call us to announce every visitor waiting in reception and so what did they do.....they arranged for IT support to call us on the phone in the bedroom to sort out our IT problem! At this point, we just decided to call it quits and head home. Essentially, the rooms are fine, food is very average and service is very good. The rooms and the service are worthy of 4 stars, the buffet food is not.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: charise7
Reviews.Content: We really love this hotel...perfect location, it is near in the beach and malls. Their unique room makes me feel very comfortable, staffs are friendly, helpful and approachable, they anticipate our needs to make you feel welcome. Lobby, rooms and the whole hotel are very clean and modern, buffet breakfast has excellent food and good ambiance...for me this is the perfect hotel to stay that you would deffinitely come back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rayne_gcp
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Stylish room with very comfy beds and nice see-through bathroom. Perfect location. Near the marina, public beach and malls. Good value for money. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Pool with A View - A paradise in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: mjantonio
Reviews.Content: A hidden oasis along Dubai Media CIty/Internet City is the Media One Hotel Pool. With a spectacular view of the Palm Jumeirah and nearby buildings.. you would feel you are in heaven! Great music fills the air whilst you sunlounge. Too bad MDek had its off-season already! Not to forget to mention the very helpful staff of Media One. All smiles which as they always say... Welcome to their funky world (you would see around their lifts and all!) Great place.. Can't wait for more surprises! By the way, public areas such as the pool deck, restaurants and lobby have free WiFi access... thus I had this opportunity this awesome experience that I'm having right now.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, fun and great service.”
Reviews.Author: RepublicOfMancunia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Media One Hotel for a weekend with some friends and had a great time. The drinks promotion on a Thursday night, between 6 pm and 9 pm, AED 99 and drink as many spirits or beers as you like, was a great start to the weekend. The huge projected sports screen in Cafe M, was excellent quality and the staff were attentive without being in your face. All in all a great relaxing experience in funky surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of mixed impressions”
Reviews.Author: MichalZ77
Reviews.Content: This is mine third time I am staying at Media One. My initial impression was really good, but somehow it is getting worse with the time. Generally the hotel is very modern and stuff appears to be professional but there are some buts: - They promise you things, but you have to ask them three times to get it done - They misplaced my laundry and as a result I stayed without a shirts for important business meetings and had to wear casual clothes - They let my guest to wait on airport for 2hours, because the driver had another client - When asked them for a help with arranging pickup I was put 3-times on hold. - I have got me upgrade, based on promise that separate bed will be brought to the apartment where I am staying, again just a promise. One would think that they would pay more attention to a frequenting quest. Especially since the hotel is not that big. All the above mentioned things make for me and average hotel from a property that has a potentional to be extraordinary. As a result I will look for different accommodation when I am next time in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Lively weekend!”
Reviews.Author: den_bam33
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous party weekend......just wanted to have a break away from day to day so booked in for 2 nights...thursday & friday. Had a very social Chees & Wine night in cafe bar on ground floor so much fun and the souffle was to die for. Great room...not huge but very clean and really comfy bed. I slept like a log. I missed breakfast but had a short time by pool reading....the venue is stunning...shame it was a little too hot to enjoy more. Then it was time for Brunch....or should I say party..it was brilliant! So lively and so many different people just having fun. Lots of great cocktails and good food. Service could have been better but most staff were helpful...even if they needed training. Would definitely choose to spend another weekend with fun people!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Trendy”
Reviews.Author: jamaicanmecrazy910
Reviews.Content: Great location, hip and trendy hotel! Stayed here for a week, and their accommodation was great. The room service food is amazing as well! Great for the amount that we paid for!! Only con is that I found a piece of hair in bed...but whatever. Try to ask for floors 15 and under so you can get free wifi in your room :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sea7s
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay at this hotel and it is highly recommended for solo as will as couples and even family. the metro is in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for trendy young things!”
Reviews.Author: Wardy1978
Reviews.Content: Now I'm no longer trendy young thing, but I still enjoyed my stay at this great hotel. Rooms are stylish and the facilities are good for a mid price hotel. Great location for making use of the beach clubs and restaurants at the pricier hotels, like the Mina and Grosvenor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Be back definitelly :)”
Reviews.Author: JaskoKuwait
Reviews.Content: Perfectly clean rooms as well all hotel facilities. Very modern rooms with all you need for short or long stay. Amazing swimming pool on the 8th floor with music and refreshments during all day till late night. This is kind of hotel which enterntein you that you may stay in hotel without going out - there is all you need either you looking for fun or just relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “ok location, worst staff ever come accross! never again!”
Reviews.Author: dsmth78
Reviews.Content: Seven of my friends and clients were at media one. We agreed a package and when the bill came it was double, the staff were so rude and would not even discuss the matter, instead made threats. I followed this up as felt so angry and still they could not understand what my issue was and offered me 10% refund, which i obviously refused. I could go on as the emails i had from staff were hillarious.Staff rerally need some training there, as I have stayed and booked in many hotels in dubai over 4yrs and this was worst by far. I thought i would try something different from the normal places we have been but was a bad mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaltsUK
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights on a room only basis as the next best bed & breakfast deal added 178Dirhams per night and you can get a good breakfast elsewhere for around 40Dirhams per person. We had planned to spend a few days relaxing around the pool but this is not possible. The music is constant to a level that even with your own Ipod on full you get the hotels chosen beats. To be honest it got a bit relentless, even in the corridors. We were told this was only Fridays but that is just the loudest, the music is on constantly to some degree. There are no sun loungers around the pool but it has double open top 4 poster cabana beds and the ones in the sun quickly fill up. On a Friday/Saturday tparticularly when they are full of the beautiful crowd getting hammered (expat groups). The twin room we had was a good size and modern although on a night you could hear the music from the disco around the pool. We asked to move but were told the hotel was full and we should just join the party. We did look at some of the other rooms and all looked ok although not so sure about the glass walls of the bathroom, not for the shy as there were no curtains between bathroom & bedroom. The signage to the hotel could do with addressing as we had a few problems with taxis not knowing how to find the entrance. Actually on arrival in a taxi from Abu Dhabi it took over an hour to find the hotel and when we did the driver couldn't turn in and we ended back on a motorway out of town AGAIN! The hotel is about 20/25minutes walk to the nearest public beach but only 10Dirhams in a taxi and the beach area now has "The Beach Walk" with various good food places although none serve alcohol as are not attached to hotels. If you can get a decent deal, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again but after the first few attempts at relaxing around the pool decided the only way to relax was to go to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Media one...number one”
Reviews.Author: pabehan20
Reviews.Content: Two Biggs with breakfast 55bd or 110 euro. Can't go wrong for two people sharing with a two year old boy. Reception was slow and they did not really know the area. Only 5 mins from the metro which is linked to Dubai mall and mall of the emirates amongst others. Great time...nice pool. Very young and hip crowd. Music goes on at the pool until 2am and then the plug is pulled. Two great nights...go for it.

Reviews.Title: “average experience”
Reviews.Author: pcd123
Reviews.Content: arriavl and departure formalities were pathetic and the experience was really very poor room was very small and suffocated food quality was average and there was very limited veg. choice in food items no spa facilities hotel recommends nearest spa and for room guests there is no discounts on offer even if u take 2/3 therapies House keeping ok room serice poor

Reviews.Title: “Great design and location, shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: grantdholmes
Reviews.Content: I recebntly stayed at the Media One in Dubai having cisited Dubai on business many times. The place is hip nad funky, the rooms are well designed and you are surrounded by other hip, Macc Book Air and iPhone weilding guests! The staff however are sultry and clearly consider guests and inconvenience to be dealt with. Keep the hotel, dump the staff! In fairness the location is excellent so that might be the compromise.

Reviews.Title: “Great, trendy, very lovley hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yasser-kh
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at media one and i really liked it , the best thing is the staff they were very friendly and helpfull all the time. Very good location with great view on the palm . And many nearby cafe's and market shop.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: Flyfille
Reviews.Content: Uncomfortable bed-check no allergy friendly carpet-check staff knock on the door while do not disturb is asked-check reception unprofessional-check poolarea has no sun-check poolarea has strong smell of sewer-check no free wifi in rooms-check ... hallways and room has a funny smell..heavy smell of airfreshener, and soaps and shower gel is very masculin!! this is better suitet as a youth hostel and not for the business traveller in a business area of Dubai. Will not recommend it and will not stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Hip and moder”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: Primarely for younger guests. Modern rooms with ok views. Good breakfast. Free WIFI in common areas. Hotel close to Dubai Marina and Emirates Golf Club.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel but I'm not Hip”
Reviews.Author: maraalfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the media one not out of choice as I didn't book it. Lobby very noisy on arrival as its open to the loud bar. Rooms small and clear open plan into shower and toilet really not my cup of tea. The hotel was clean and staff friendly enough, would probably suit the younger guest in their 20s.

Reviews.Title: “In love with itself - but contempt for its' guests”
Reviews.Author: tim094
Reviews.Content: This place loves itself - but it's unrequited! There are signs in the (OK, but a bit dusty) rooms with single word like "fashionable", "funky" etc. Maybe they should calm down a bit and let the paying guests decide for themselves? And concentrate on the people paying. The hotel itself is OK - convenient if you want to be in Media City. But the insincere staff and contemptible service are just hideous. A classic case of now we have your money we will do no more - 4 email requests for something as simple as a receipt have been ignored. And the stupid thing is that they have an OK and convenient hotel; one you would come back to if they were as in love with paying guests as they were with Media One.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: rosumalmo
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at Media One for a week, we found a great deal incl breakfast. Positive: 1. Clean and easy accessible 2. Free wireless int. in the lobby/restaurants/pool area 3. Good breakfast 4. Friendly and helpful staff Negative: 1. If you´re looking for space, this is not the hotel (if not staying in one of the suites) 2. The glasswalls between the toilet/the bathroom and the rest of the room is something that would have felt quite weird if travelling with someone else than my husband. I would recommend a dating couple to stay somewhere else/different room. 3. Noisy when it´s party time at the Med restaurant (a couple of times a week) 4. Wouldn´t bring kids to the hotel. It´s more suitable for a bunch of friends, couples and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Dubai Marina and Jumeirah beach”
Reviews.Author: greta_andrea
Reviews.Content: This hotel has competitive rates if compared with other hotels in the same area. We loved the design of the lobby, lift and room, the restaurant "the Med". From the pool deck you have nice views of the palm jumeirah. Unfortunately the pool is totally shaded all day long (maybe during summer this could be ok), but there is a small separated area with sunbeds where you can enjoy the sun from 11.30 until 16.00. Although the pool is in shadow the water is hot (29°C) and so it was very nice to swim. We appreciated the room which was very soundproofed (we weren't located above the pool, but on the side of the building and so during evening party we could sleep without noises), we loved the big window and the Ipod station. The best thing is the location: you can reach Dubai Marina (one of the newest and coolest area of the city) with an easy five minute walk; you can walk to JBR beach in 30 minutes or take the bus n°8 which stops in front of the hotel and goes to JBR in 5 minutes. The metro station is only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We appreciated also the fact that there were very few children staying in the hotel, and so it was very quiet. The staff iwas helpful and smiling! The only complaints are about the cleanness of the room which could be better, the fridge which wasn't working, the chair which was damaged and the bath products which could be better, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice funcky Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: Media One is a nice, stylish hotel in Dubai with interesting interior architecture, addressed mainly to young couples. The small size of the rooms is counterbalanced by a glass bathroom wall that gives an airy feeling to the room. That being said, hotel is not designed for family stays, although it worked out greatly in our case with a junior suite and an additional standard room. Part of the hotel rooms overlook the Palm and Atlantis hotel. Rooms with king size beds are bigger and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very trendy rooms”
Reviews.Author: bojantercon
Reviews.Content: Located in Media City, which is not really close to anything ... but then nothing is in Dubai ... perfect place to stay for a couple of days. The rooms are compact but ultra-modern and trendy. Has great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for holidays in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: glooobetrotter75
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days in this hotel during my transit back from china. I enjoyed the place, it's very well equiped and has nice views all over. I will certainly come back to it when I will return to Dubai

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_Cartwright
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with good facilities. The fitness centre is conveniently located next to the pool, which provides a nice place for relaxation. It is always easy to get a taxi outside the hotel for exploring Dubai. The room itself was very modern and clean. The bathroom was also well designed and clean. Staff were helpful, although the food in the restaurant was not the best. All in all, a nice stay in a nice hotel. Great Value for money in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jansait
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Media One hotel for 3 nights during a business trip to Dubai. Stayed at the HIP VIP room. Nice view, cool room, great service, good breakfast. I wish the room had an iron though. but over all, it was a nice stay and everything was perfect. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place but standards lower in some respects”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times now which in itself is a clear statement that I find it an acceptable place to stay for the price. The rooms are clean and modern and there is generally a good feel to the place. Staff are friendly and the bar on the ground floor can get lively - though the very lively Barasti Bar down at the Le Meridien is within walking distance. But a few things need to be watched, for example the breakfast tables were not cleared, cleaned and re-set properly - a real shame because the breakfast is good. The coffee with breakfast is poor - they used to have a coffee machine making fresh ground coffee but now it is just a large pot. Apparently the swimming pool water is too cold - I have never had a chance to try it. Still no wi-fi in the rooms so iPad users have to sit in reception to access the Internet and MacBook Air users have to remember to bring a USB to Ethernet adaptor - quite a nuisance, also Internet access is not free in the rooms. The hotel restaurant is reasonably good. There is a Vapiano restaurant next door (pizza, pasta, salads) and a convenience type store a short walk away. It is also a relatively short though not very convenient walk down to the Westin and Le Meridien hotels which have quite a few restaurants between them. Taxis are often waiting otherwise reasonably frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and More!”
Reviews.Author: jc310
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked online, site unseen. Well we couldn't have made a better choice. It was super clean, always things going on, but yet when it was time to turn in, it was peacefully quiet. All the employees, where more than nice and always willing to help. For instance if you need information on anything from a restaurant to an attraction, please see Fuad (head consierge) he is a wealth of knowlege and an extremely nice guy. There is also Kennedy, he is the man to go to for info. on nightlife, he never disappointed. I would absolutly stay in this hotel if I ever visit Dubai again. Don't have a bad thing to say!

Reviews.Title: “Hip 'n' loud”
Reviews.Author: FabFabFabFab
Reviews.Content: Very hip and modern hotel. Godd thing is that you have free WiFi in the lobby. The hotel is located in an area where there is no very much to see and do. You get a taxi anytime right in front of the door. Food is good, I tried B'fast, lunch and dinner. Bar is nice. Rooms are rather small and there was no shower (only tub with a too short curtain). We were two in the room (and I paid more as we were two) but the room was equipped only for as a single room (only one soap, bathrobe etc.) Biggest problem is the noise. If they give you a room that faces the pool area, you better have earplugs with you as at night they have parties going on all night. Thursday night until 3 a.m. The walls are very thin and you hear everything, from outside and even when somebody accesses his room. All in all the hotel is "OK" but not convenient if you are on business and for holiday it is located not very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: raq138
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Media one for 6 nights. I can honestly say that the hotel was great the staff were more than accomodating and very friendly. The hotel location was ideal to get around Dubai. Pool area was clean but was in the shade for most of the day due to the high rise buildings surrounding the hotel. Ladies night & pool party was busy with a lively atmosphere. Ensure you request a sea view room. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel with paper thin walls so not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Scirocco-frk
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel in the Dubai Media City area. Rooms are not large but well equipped. Bathroom is nice (all glass walls). Shower is not so convinient. Restaurant and bar are good. Food was good. Did not use the breakfast. (Around the corner there is a nice bakery / small supermarket). Main concern is the noice in the room. Not from outside but from the neighboors and hallway. If people walk in the hallway it is as they are walking right through your room. If a neighboor returns to his room you can basically enjoy every singe thing he/she does..... Location, is not really that convinient. Nothing to do around the hotel weo of a buffet style italian restaurant (pretty good though) and the said mini bakery. The walk to the metro station (American University) is about 10 minutes. Taxi's are easy to find. This is one of these hotels where they tried everything to make it special but I am not sure if it really worked out. I would still recommend it as long as you take earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy0701
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, the pool is good and the amenities is SUPERB!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JieV
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel which is stylish and distinctive then I would suggest trying the Media One Hotel. From the outside everything looks ordinary but wait ‘til you get inside. The rooms may not be very spacious but it is definitely chic. It’s very clean and cozy. Very nice place for a couple as the bathroom walls are made of glass. It adds more romantic feel to your stay. The staffs are all friendly and accommodating. The rates are really competitive. Amenities on the 8th floor are excellent. Swimming pool area was designed perfectly since there’s a building beside the hotel which covers the sun during the afternoon. So need not worry of getting roasted under the sun if you want to swim during the mid-day. Although extending the hours of the use of swimming pool would be better as at the moment it is only open until 7pm. Overall I would say our stay was very refreshing and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there were hotels like this in London”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: This is a modern style hotel which means it looks and feels clean, organized and easy to stay in, all for a mid range price. The basic rooms are quite small but very efficiently arranged and quite comfortable. Of course there are things that could be improved like Internet connection which really should be wired and wireless in the rooms as well as free (at the time of writing it was wired and for a fee). There is a bar on the ground floor which really does get quite lively on some nights and the restaurant o the 8th floor does a good breakfast and dinner (I haven't tried the lunch). I would not class this as a tourist hotel but it tries to be hip and trendy which suggests to me it is not trying to be a normal business hotel. Anyone looking for a more comfortable and slightly classy tourist hotel should try the Westin down the road otherwise Media One is a good place to stay in the Media City area.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, a bit too hip.”
Reviews.Author: AntonioShanghai
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights there during a recent business trip. Hotel is brand new. Style is a bit too "hip- cool", which is not mine. Lots of "techno / hip-style" entertainment. Rather geared at 30+ Clientèle. Rooms are smartly appointed but extremely small. You'd think you are in Tokyo or Hong Kong, not opulent Dubai, but it's true that the rates were extremely competitive. Low occupation was apparent everywhere in this place. Clearly suffering the crisis- hit Dubai with an untimely opening. Breakfast buffet very decent, and room service food quality very good. A keeper at the current crisis prices.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel that takes you away from work”
Reviews.Author: T2P2
Reviews.Content: I think its a new concept in trendy hotel , my forst impression was a bit guarded but the 2 days that I spent there was refreshing .... especially after hard days work , its perfect place to unwind . Everything in that hotel has a difference and thats refreshing . When you travel a lot , you want to see something different .... Media one has it all . The food , ambience , bar all had different setting .... hip and trendy. The rooms are also designed to cater to . The rooms may not be very spacious but it has everything you want .... room service is very prompt .

Reviews.Title: “Great unforgettable place!”
Reviews.Author: AndaCanada
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Dubai, thanks to Media One they made our vacation very memorable. The hotel is more than you expected it to be. Clean, spacious, courteous receptionist, quiet room, cool ambiance, what else can I say? It was worth our money! Even more. If you're planning a trip to Dubai, Media One is the "only" place to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, lovely hotel, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTravel143
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Media One with me and my hubby. For young couple like us we find it very accommodating, elegant and just relaxing and the great view of the city at night from our room made our entire trip. Very helpful staff, clean and very well presented rooms, and we had a fantastic time at the pool bar. I even enjoyed my visit at the gym. Considering it's location and accessibility to any shopping and sports destination of the city, is simply very convenient not to mention it's real good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC & AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: yazzmundo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Media one Hotel on many occasions and it has never failed to provide me with good quality service. The rooms are very clean and have ample of space. Attention to detail in looking after you is very good. the pool deck is very good on most nights, its a must for Thursday's and Fridays where the music is spot on! I usually go to Dubai on business, this time I took some friends with me and they too have expressed how brilliant the hotel is! The free Wi-Fi in the lobby is good, bearing in mind that other nearby hotels charge for this privilege! Friday Brunch is well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: dubaidreaming
Reviews.Content: A great new trendy hotel within walking distance to the beach and the marina. Funky pool deck with live DJ on tuesdays, thursdays and Fridays! Careful not to fall in the pool after too much drink! (it happens) Really good food and presentation from room service even at 4am in the morning! Young and competent staff who are really keen to help! Good value weekend brunch. Overall fantastic value for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “If you want a night's sleep and you're in a twin room, bring ear plugs.”
Reviews.Author: anythingbutIndian
Reviews.Content: If you're a more mature traveller, (over thirty), then this is not the place for you. It's a party hotel and the twin rooms are on the swimming pool side with loud music starting at 10.30 each evening. Bathrooms have a half wall and see-through glass.... no privacy!

Reviews.Title: “young and modern but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ing��
Reviews.Content: A good hotel if your young, stay for a couple of days and enjoy good shopping in Dubai. Pool is most of the time in the shadow of the building which might make sense in the hot season but is far to cold in March when we were there. On week-ends there is disco at the pool. If your room is on the wrong side you won't sleep before 3 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Bi-Polar Media One”
Reviews.Author: Xophe
Reviews.Content: I have mixed views on the Media One Hotel. The rooms are very comfy, clean, and well laid out. The staff are immensely helpful, and the hotel isn't very far from Dubai Marina. The only dissapointing aspect of the hotel is that they insist on having very loud music playing out in the pool area most evenings - which is fine if you're there for the actual party taking place. However, i was not, and i am sure most of the other guests weren't either. Although there were al alrge quantity of drinken 20-somethings in the lobby when i went down to complain about the music. As i say, the staff were good, and did move me to a room on the opposite side of the hotel which was marginally quieter. So, bi-polar Media One? Well i think the management need to make a decision as the whether they are running a nightclub with a hotel attached, or a hotel with pool bar. As a business traveller, i dont want to be located next to a nightclub when i am trying to sleep. However, a day-time pool-party vibe would work for me if it didnt go on until 12am. If it wasnt for the music, this would be a great hotel. Until that gets sorted, i wouldnt recommend staying there unless you had a choice of there or Ibiza.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !!!”
Reviews.Author: noofr
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Media One Hotel on March 26.I found it to be a very lovely place with amazingly friendly staff. The hotel was very highly maintained and the ambience of the lobby was amazing.It is most definitely the newest IT hotel in Dubai.The elevator is worth a mention and it was so CHIC.The room was so comfortable and the view from my room was SO AMAZING.i was up in my room for hours( for the view).The room washroom was so cool.....it was glass walled .....and the bath tub and the bath shower was amazing.My routine shower was amazingly relaxing here.Next the pool was so relaxing ...the location of the pool was the best .....8th floor !!!.Next came the dinner ...the Z Zone the M bar was so posh...the food was THE best.I had left a special thank you for the chefs and the E Commerce Manager.At late night about 3 -4 am, i required extra blankets and voila i called the house keeping and they were there in a minute.The morning breakfast was so appetizing.A large variety of breads ,cereals,fruits,fruit juices,tea,coffee,chefs on standby....it was amazing.Plus they had the morning newspapers in different languages kept too. I am recommending it to everyone and also looking forward to visiting the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: S_yorksTravelbug
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights. after a horrid time at the airport and feeling very poorley we arrived at the hotel at 2am to be greeted by very friendly staff, check in was very smooth. the room was very modern, clean and comfertable and the storage was great too. unfortunatly i got very ill and needed a doctor. the reception staff were fantastic, as the hotel doctor had finished for day and they could not locate the nurse, the staff drove me and my husband imeidatly to a clinic where i was seen to and they also waited for us, took us to a pharmacy and then back to the hotel. All the staff seem to do whatever they can to accomadate your needs, even dragging our sunloungers round to meet with our need for the sun. all in all a great find The bar is very busy on promotion nights yet a little too quite on others. i can't comment on the resturant as we didnt eat there, but it all looked good. The location was great, just a short taxi ride to most places and as for value for money, i think it would be hard to beat. i would definatley stay again as a couple, just a shame in my opinion that they dont allow children.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Hip indeed”
Reviews.Author: gru20
Reviews.Content: My stay at Media One Hotel was wonderful and amazing. Very courteous and friendly staff. I booked the Cool Room with the Palm Jumeirah View. The location was also central to everywhere I needed to go. Had no trouble catching cabs as the hotel always has them on stand by. It is also not too far from the Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa, the world's Tallest Building. In short, an excellent stay. Will stay here the next time I am in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value, Not Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kruzzi
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best value-for-money hotel I've ever stayed in. It was very pleasant and really nice rooms. It's clearly a trendy hotel, aimed presumably at younger travellers and business men. Everything is very new, and it's still relatively quiet so service is very fast, and there's plenty of space / tables free when you need them. Pool is great, sauna and steam are also o.k. One note is that the net connections are highly and somewhat randomly filtered, e.g. you can't get to Skype or Flickr, but Skype works if you're already running it. You'll also want to do some preparation in advance if you want to bypass the Dubai firewall. Highly recommended as a hotel when staying for business / city seeing. Tip: make sure you ask for a no smoking bedroom. Also the higher the better.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in Dubai Media City, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mcabiling
Reviews.Content: Trendy new hotel in Dubai. Rooms are modern and well equipped. Convenient location in Dubai Media City. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it - why the music everywhere?”
Reviews.Author: LostinthePost
Reviews.Content: I work in KSA and regularly come to Dubai to relax and enjoy the more liberal environment. Although check-in went smoothly and courteously my first impression of the non-smoking room was that it smelled of stale smoke. I was initially glad to be overlooking the pool until I came back to my room after dinner to be greeted by the sound of thundering house music coming from the pool area. On looking out of the window it appeared there was a DJ playing to an empty pool bar. I used to review clubs and events for one of the world's biggest electronic music magazines so I'm not averse to this style of music, but he was mixing badly to an empty venue and really not selecting appropriate music. Moreover, I was on the 15th floor and even at this height the sound was intrusively loud enough to prevent sleep; on calling the reception they informed me this would go on until 3am. I really have to question whether hosting this type of event there is worth it for the hotel. I am guessing that, like myself, anyone who stays in any of the rooms that overlook the pool will be subject to the same intrusion. This is presumably an average 25% of their guests at any time(the hotel has 4 sides of which this is 1), if we assume that half of these people will be sufficiently upset by the noise that they will not return to the hotel then, on any given weekend, this setup is alienating approximately 12.5% of Media One's guests. If they are making a fortune from the pool bar that plays inappropriate music then this wouldn't be an issue, but the party looked rather poorly attended; meanwhile i'm sure the alienated guests will tell their friends and colleagues not to bother staying at Media One. What about playing some lounge music or laid back Jazz at tolerable levels, wouldn't that be more unique in Dubai's entertainment scene than another venue for hard commercial house music? I complained to the front desk and insisted I move room. They found me the same grade of room on the other side of the hotel luckily; had another room not been available then I have no idea how I would have coped with the noise and might have had to check-out. Having moved room I called down to the front desk several times since I had forgotten items in the first room. Despite calling 4 times the phone rang out and no reply came. Eventually I had to go downstairs to speak to the receptionist myself to arrange this. This was 1-30am, reception was deserted and I have no idea why it had not been possible to answer my calls over the previous half hour. The receptionist sent a concierge to escort me for the retrieval of my items. Previous comments mention the hotel's desperate attempts to be 'cool', whatever that means these days it certainly isn't going on at Media One. I would echo previous reviewers and feel the property really needs to sort out what it wants to be. Is it a business property serving visitors to the TECOM developments, or is it some sort of urban party venue for early 20 somethings that want to drink excessively? If it is the former then management need to rein-in what are apparently attempts to be the latter; life in the hotel seems to take place to a constant backdrop of loud commercial house music; it's in the lobby, the lift, at breakfast, by the pool - is it necessary to be constantly exposed to this? Looking at the guests who came into breakfast the majority are businessmen and women who aren't there for some sort of sauced-up Ibiza weekend meanwhile the hotel's atmosphere, Friday brunch and bars all seem aimed at bringing-in a crowd of wannabe reality TV contestants that you can observe staggering wastedly in and out of the lobby on a Friday evening. Of course, cherry-picking these two demographics wouldn't be an issue if servicing one of them didn't come at the detriment of pleasing the other. But, after overhearing conversations at breakfast, I know for a fact I won't be the only one not returning to Media One. I hope that pool party makes them enough money to compensate for the fact they will have very few repeat guests.

HotelInfo.Name: Media One Hotel Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Dubai Media City, Plot No. 1 | Behind American University, Dubai 121818 , United Arab Emirates
